info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 12:22PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Otero County through 100 PM MDT... At 1222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Sacramento, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Timberon, Sacramento, Weed, Hay Canyon and Bluff Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
